intro: Hepetis taenipetala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flowers with pale blue to purple petals. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in specialized gardens.
